description.plain:
Philadelphia-born Sabrina Annlynn Carpenter (born May 11, 1999) is an American singer-songwriter and actress. She made her debut as a child actress in Season 12, Episode 12 of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit. In 2013 and 2014, she lent her voice to Princess Vivian on Disney Junior’s Sofia The First.

In 2014, Carpenter landed her first major acting role as Maya Hart on Disney’s Girl Meets World, a spinoff of the hit sitcom Boy Meets World, in which she sang the theme song “Take On the World” with Rowan Blanchard. The same year, she released her first single, “Can’t Blame A Girl For Trying”, which received a Radio Disney Music Award.

In 2014, after signing with Hollywood Records, she released her debut EP, Can’t Blame a Girl for Trying. In 2015, she released her debut studio album, Eyes Wide Open. In 2016, lead single On Purpose preceded the release of her second studio album EVOLution, in which she experimented with a more mature pop sound and elements of dance and tropical house.

In 2018, the Philly pop star dropped her third album, Singular: Act I, followed by Act II a year later.

Carpenter’s fifth studio album, emails i can’t send, was released on July 2022, followed by singles from September 2021, “skinny dipping,” February 2022, “Fast Times,” and July 2021, “Vicious.” The fifth album track, “because i liked a boy,” also ended up being a single after the album’s release.

songs.full_title: Skin by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Skin

description.plain:
Serving as an alleged response to Olivia Rodrigo’s wildly popular “drivers license,” “Skin” is a message to all the people that sent her hate for being with Joshua Bassett and also has lines that appear to be directly addressed at Rodrigo.

The song is Sabrina Carpenter’s first single release in 2021 and her first with her new record label Island Records. The song was a surprise release announced by Sabrina on her Twitter and Instagram on January 21, 2021.

songs.full_title: Thumbs by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Thumbs

description.plain:
“Thumbs” was released on October 7, 2016 as a promotional single for Sabrina Carpenter’s sophomore album EVOLution, and was later released as an official single on January 3, 2017. It is the ninth song performed on Carpenter’s headline tour of the same name.

“Thumbs” is a song about not becoming someone who just goes along with everybody else and how everyone in the world is the same in some way.

This song is about how people go through the same routines every day without thinking. The main phrase of the chorus means that people may or may not see a problem in what is going on with what they or others are doing, but they do not do anything about it.  The saying “twiddle your thumbs” means “to do nothing for a period of time, usually while you are waiting for something to happen”.

songs.full_title: Nonsense by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Nonsense

description.plain:
On “Nonsense,” Sabrina talks about her feelings for her significant other and how she gets so anxious around him that she loses control of her mouth and starts blabbering nonsense.

Over a guitar-based instrumental, she plays on the nonsense concept and uses a humorous selection of terminology on the song’s Pre-Chorus and bridge.

songs.full_title: ​because i liked a boy by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​because i liked a boy

description.plain:
“​because i liked a boy” deals with the perceptions and sometimes-harsh assumptions that Sabrina faced after fans made her into a tertiary villain in a Disney-actor love triangle with Olivia Rodrigo and Joshua Bassett.

Recounting her experience, Sabrina compares the innocence of her and Joshua’s relationship to the brutal reaction of the public, all because she liked a boy.

songs.full_title: Why by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Why

description.plain:
“Why” is a single by Sabrina Carpenter, released on July 7th, 2017. The song is about her and a guy being completely opposite, but they’re made for each other.

She talked to Billboard about her first single and said

This song happened very quickly. We started with the first line of the song – ‘You like New York City in the daytime; I like New York City in the night time’ – and from there, the song kind of wrote itself. It’s basically [about] these differences that we all have, that keep us different from one another but at the same time glue us together. … I like to say it’s very conversational, which some of my other songs haven’t been before.

songs.full_title: ​emails i can't send by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​emails i can’t send

description.plain:
On “emails i can’t send,” Sabrina shares her past, from the perspective of a daughter who discovered that her father had an affair. The lyrics show in a beautiful yet tragic way, the pain, disappointment, and lack of trust that came out of this situation, over soft piano sounds.

Sabrina first teased the song on her Instagram and revealed that it would serve as the introductory track. She, later on, told Spotify Storyline about the inspiration behind the track, as she stated:

The song that inspired the record. Someone I looked up to let me down and it changed the way I love and receive love."

songs.full_title: Feather by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Feather

description.plain:
“Feather” by Sabrina Carpenter is a disco-influenced pop song about cutting ties with a toxic relationship and feeling lighter as a result. In July 2023, the song was promoted as the lead single from the reissue of Carpenter’s fifth studio album, emails i can’t send fwd:, as well as serving as the fifth overall single from the album.

During the tracking week ending December 16, 2023, the song debuted at #100 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. During the tracking week ending March 30, 2024, the song reached a new peak of #26. The song marks Carpenter’s third appearance on the Hot 100, following “Skin” (#48) and “Nonsense” (#56).

songs.title: ​skinny dipping

description.plain:
“Skinny Dipping” is the second single released from Carpenter in 2021, following “Skin”. The song was released on September 9, 2021.

The title was cryptically revealed in an email sent to her mailing list on August 23rd. A snippet of the song was shared the same day.

songs.full_title: On Purpose by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: On Purpose

description.plain:
Written by Carpenter and Ido Zmishlany (who produced the track), this is the lead single from her sophomore album, EVOLution. Prior to its release, Carpenter teased the track on Instagram through a daily countdown.

“On Purpose” is an upbeat pop-dance song with elements of tropical house that celebrates a unexpected, budding relationship. The single marks a musical departure for Carpenter from the indie pop of Eyes Wide Open. It is the first song on the album track list, serving as an introduction to the theme of complicated relationships and maturity explored in EVOLution.

The music video, directed by James Miller, shows clips of Carpenter walking around London and Madrid.

songs.full_title: Sue Me by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Sue Me

description.plain:
“Sue Me” is a song about coming out on top after leaving a negative relationship by channeling the confidence and strength that was always within.

The song was inspired by a real-life lawsuit issued against Carpenter as the year prior to the release of the song, Carpenter’s former music managers sued the singer, her management, and her parents for commissions after she left the company.

The song was made the second single from its parent album, Singular: Act 1 on the same day as its release, November 9, 2018.

songs.full_title: A Nonsense Christmas by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: A Nonsense Christmas

description.plain: A Nonsense Christmas was Sabrina’s holiday remix of her popular pop hit “Nonsense” from her previous album “emails i can’t send”. She incorporates holiday wordplay and dirty jokes to give the song a holiday twist. The song was originally released on December 7th, 2022 and was added to her following Christmas album “fruitcake” on November 17th, 2023.

songs.full_title: Vicious by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Vicious

description.plain:
On “Vicious,” Sabrina sings in an angry way about this vicious person who manipulated her saying that he loved her. Carpenter emphasizes in each line how this person is different from how everyone believes and how he deceived her by saying that he loved her and left without remorse.

Prior to its release, Carpenter teased the song by posting a pre-save link and sharing a snippet of the song on TikTok. She revealed the track title and release date via a Spotify playlist.

songs.full_title: ​decode by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​decode

description.plain: “decode” is the thirteenth and final track on Sabrina Carpenter’s fifth album, emails i can’t send. The song touches on Carpenter’s inability to accept situations that are out her control. Being hard on herself and blaming herself for the entirety of the situation. This song is a reminder to herself to accept whatever happens in her life as it is. “You are past the point of asking questions and asking Whys and asking Hows. It just is what it is.” Carpenter says in an interview with Rolling Stone.

songs.full_title: Fast Times by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Fast Times

description.plain:
Announced in “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” on January 4, 2022, ‘Fast Times’ is the first single from Carpenter in 2022 which is part of her fifth album, emails i can’t send.

Fast Times is about a youthful romance full of impulsive decisions. The story moves quickly, demonstrating how quickly this love affair transpired. In the song Sabrina only focuses on enjoying the present, the emotional repercussions will be processed later.

The song was teased for the first time in New Year’s Day on Sabrina’s Instagram with the caption:

new music 2022 yes or yes vote below

Carpenter announced on February 4, 2022 on an Instagram post the date and cover art of the single.

songs.full_title: Exhale by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Exhale

description.plain:
“Exhale” is the second single from Sabrina Carpenter’s album Singular: Act II. Sabrina performed this song as the encore for all of her shows on the Singular Tour in both the US and Asia.

She said she had written it only a few weeks prior to tour beginning, but knew it needed to be on the setlist. On the second night of the tour, she said the reception to the song was so good that she was considering putting it on the album.

In a livestream with Top Magazine on her Brazilian visit in April 2019, she said Exhale was the most difficult song for her to sing on tour as she ‘gets very emotional’, and had also stated that it was coming out ‘very soon’. In the livestream she also addressed her fans' reception describing how they had made it their own and therefore stating how important the song was to her.

Sabrina wrote this song mostly about her anxiety. As she sings, “Can I exhale for a minute?” shows that she is having trouble getting her problems out, hence the lyric, “Can I get this out in the open?”.

songs.full_title: Almost Love by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Almost Love

description.plain:
“Almost Love” is the lead single from Sabrina Carpenter’s third album, Singular: Act 1.

The song was premiered at iHeartRadio’s Wango Tango 2018 four days before the release of the song.



Prior to its release, Sabrina posted two videos on her Instagram, teasing the song. She also posted the cover art in between with the release date.

Sabrina also stated on an Instagram livestream (6/5/18) that this was one of the last songs she wrote for the album, Singular.

The song was most likely written only two months before its release, as Carpenter shared on her Twitter some of the song’s lyrics on April 19th, 2018:
https://twitter.com/SabrinaAnnLynn/status/987042176528859136

The song portrays a casual relationship that is not taken seriously by either person until it’s time to say goodbye, but Sabrina starts to become attached to this person and wants them to be more than a casual fling.

songs.full_title: Tornado Warnings by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Tornado Warnings

description.plain:
On “Tornado Warnings” Sabrina sings about her habit to ignore red flags metaphorically tornado warnings, she’s only viewing the good in the person she sings about. She wants to keep this person by her side, even if she knows they’re bad for her.

The song starts out simply with a bassline and a pad loop, as it progresses into the chorus drums come in, Sabrina starts to sing in a more talkative flow and it gives the song a beautiful poetic vibe.

songs.full_title: Paris by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Paris

description.plain:
“Paris,” is an ode to escaping town to find love, only to realize you already had it.

Backed by a steady guitar riff, cinematic percussion, and pulsating synths, the song is a sultry highlight from its parent album, Singular: Act I.

The song was released as a promotional single on October 24, 2018, weeks before the album was released.

At Club Sabrina, an exclusive event that Sabrina hosted in multiple cities around the US, she told her fans to close their eyes and imagine themselves in Paris while listening to the song.

songs.full_title: Looking at Me by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Looking at Me

description.plain: They had the melodies and the production for a whole day but they couldn’t think of any lyrics. Then Sabrina went into the booth and just freestyled and ended up saying that everybody was looking at her. The album is all about that — it’s all about that owning your confidence. She’s the center of attention right now and she’s gonna deal with who she is. Sabrina said that it’s a message that we don’t hear all the time because it usually seems too cocky.

songs.full_title: ​how many things by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​how many things

description.plain:
On “how many things,” the song portrays a more vulnerable side of Carpenter by discussing how she feels worthless in the eyes of her lover because he no longer shows her any attention.

The song utilizes a guitar instrumental as it offers an insight into Carpenter’s emotions. Rhetorical questions about why her significant other has been so distant also run through her mind, throughout the song’s chorus.

description.plain: On “opposite”, Carpenter sings about a ex that she cared about, and even contemplated changing her appearance to be a guy’s dream girl, but it wouldn’t have worked, because he always wanted someone else. She now realizes that she wasn’t this guy’s type, and he was biding time with her until he got the girl he wanted. The track was teased in an email Carpenter sent to her fans which she titled, announcements i can’t make. In the email there was a folder, and when you clicked on it, it took you to a page where there was a teaser for this song.

songs.full_title: ​things i wish you said by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​things i wish you said

description.plain: “​things i wish you said” is the final track on emails i can’t send fwd:,  the re-issue of Sabrina Carpenter’s fifth studio album, which was released on March 17, 2023. The album closer follows Carpenter thinking over things she wished she had heard from her now ex. On the final chorus, Carpenter admits that she wasted time thinking and fantasizing about things she wished her ex said.

songs.full_title: ​bet u wanna by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​bet u wanna

description.plain:
On “bet u wanna,” the song tells the story of Carpenter’s partner leaving her but later realizing how much she’s worth.

The track begins with guitar sounds that gives off a country music vibe before transitioning to a heavy drum-based beat. The guitar and drum beats are later combined to depict a depressed Sabrina who refuses to give her significant other a second opportunity in their relationship.

songs.full_title: Bad for Business by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Bad for Business

description.plain:
“Bad for Business” is the twelfth track on Sabrina Carpenter’s fifth album, emails i can’t send. Carpenter sings about being so in love with this person that they’re taking up all her energy and time.

Carpenter teased the song before in the Skin Music Video back in 2021 before its release.

songs.full_title: Pushing 20 by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Pushing 20

description.plain:
“Pushing 20” is the first single of Singular: Act II, the second act of a two-part album by Sabrina Carpenter, with the first act being released in November 2018.

Played at the first show of the Singular Tour in Orlando in 2019, and released shortly after on March 8th, the song is about how Carpenter doesn’t care about other people’s opinions and how she would rather spend her time dealing with her own responsibilities.

songs.title: In My Bed

description.plain:
“In My Bed” is the first promotional single from Sabrina Carpenter’s fourth album, Singular: Act II. The song is about overthinking, with the title and hook being a play on the phrase “in my head”:

Sabrina explained in an interview with Substream Magazine:

It’s a clever play on words instead of saying, ‘I’m in my head about it’. The song is about one of those moments where life feels like a lot to deal with. We took that and turned it into something really fun and vulnerable.

songs.title: Lonesome

description.plain: “lonesome” is the third deluxe track in emails i can’t send fwd: ;the reissue and deluxe edition of Carpenter’s fifth album. In the lyrics, Carpenter describes her loneliness and how she feels abandoned and unwanted by her lover. The song uses a Western-styled instrumental, depicting how Carpenter feels like her life has become a desert.

songs.full_title: ​buy me presents by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​buy me presents

description.plain:
“​buy me presents” is a song by ​Sabrina Carpenter, and the second track of her Christmas EP, “​fruitcake”, released on November 17, 2023.

It is a catchy pop tune with humorous lyrics and a playful attitude. The song has an upbeat tempo and a cheerful melody, and showcases Sabrina’s vocal range and charisma.

The song is about a girl who wants her lover to spoil her with gifts and attention, and who doesn’t care about the consequences. It is a playful and sarcastic take on consumerism and materialism, as Sabrina Carpenter sings about wanting her lover to shower her with gifts and trips.

songs.full_title: Run and Hide by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Run and Hide

description.plain: Run and Hide was released on September 29, 2016, the third promotional single from Sabrina Carpenter’s sophomore album EVOLution. Sabrina believes this is the most emotional song on the album, and was written and recorded in one take. This song was written in a hotel room by Sabrina herself.

songs.full_title: Hold Tight by Sabrina Carpenter (Ft. UHMEER)
songs.title: Hold Tight

description.plain:
On “Hold Tight”, Sabrina Carpenter wants to make little rearrangements under sexy electro-R&B production.

The track see’s Carpenter collaborating with collaboration with UHMEER a.k.a. Amir Mitchell-Townes, who was Sabrina’s co-star on Girl Meets World.

It was first teased with a snippet on Sabrina’s Instagram story on January 10, 2018.
https://twitter.com/TeamSabrina/status/951057073474818048

songs.full_title: ​is it new years yet? by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​is it new years yet?

description.plain:
“​is it new years yet?” is a song by ​Sabrina Carpenter, and the fifth track of her Christmas EP, “fruitcake”, released on November 17, 2023.

The song is a pop-rock anthem that expresses Sabrina’s frustration with the holiday season and her longing for a new start in the new year. She sings about how she feels bored, lonely, and bitter during Christmas, and how she dreams of celebrating New Year’s Eve with someone new.

The song has a catchy chorus that repeats the question “is it new years yet?” and contrasts the festive symbolisms of silver and gold, champagne, and kissing with the underwhelming reality of being at home with nobody to hold.

songs.full_title: ​santa doesn't know you like i do by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​santa doesn’t know you like i do
songs.title_with_featured: ​santa doesn't know you like i do

description.plain:
“​santa doesn’t know you like i do” is a song by ​Sabrina Carpenter, and the third track of her Christmas EP, “fruitcake”, released on November 17, 2023.

The song features Sabrina Carpenter’s soothing vocals that create a melancholic mood.

The song is a pop ballad that expresses Sabrina’s longing for her lover who is away for the holidays. The lyrics contrast the superficial gifts and attention that Santa can offer with the deep connection and intimacy that Sabrina shares with her partner.

The song was accompanied by a music video, directed by Rebekah Campbell, that shows Sabrina Carpenter going up to a dark attic with some presents, and then plays an old VHS, showing her and her partner during the holidays, whilst she’s singing and reminiscing about the memories with her partner.

songs.full_title: I'm Fakin by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: I’m Fakin

description.plain:
I’m Fakin is a song by Sabrina Carpenter, from her fourth album Singular: Act II. It was released on July 12, 2019. It was written by Sabrina Carpenter, Mauricio Rengifo and Andrés Torres.
They wrote and recorded that song in an hour. It was a very quick and easy song to write and for Sabrina, one of the most fun earworm tracks on the album.

songs.full_title: Honeymoon Fades by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Honeymoon Fades

description.plain:
“Honeymoon Fades” was surprise-released by Sabrina Carpenter to coincide with Valentine’s Day 2020. In the song, she expresses her desire to experience never-ending love, and questions if the love will remain “after the honeymoon fades”.

The song was announced on her social media accounts on February 13th, 2020, accompanied by a picture of her (the single artwork) and the following caption:

surprise,
my valentine to you.
a song called
Honeymoon Fades
drops tonight at midnight💌

songs.full_title: Shadows by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Shadows

description.plain: “Shadows” is the 8th song on Sabrina Carpenter’s second album, EVOLution. This whole album depicts love, and going through certain things in life as a teenager or as a person in general. This song is about not being afraid to love and not turning away from someone you love because of their flaws and past. At the San Antonio date of Carpenter’s EVOlution tour, the emotional impact of this song reportedly made Carpenter cry onstage.

songs.full_title: Mona Lisa by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Mona Lisa

description.plain:
On “Mona Lisa,” American recording artist Sabrina Carpenter waits for a crush to approach her first.

The shortest track from the album, at a cutting 2:18, gets a sensual synth-poppy production thanks to Oliver Peterhof & The Monsters & Strangerz.

The song’s reference to the painting by Leonardo da Vinci the “Mona Lisa” matches a reoccurring theme of Carpenter’s love of “Paris”. The painting is on show at The Louvre in the city.

songs.full_title: ​prfct by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: ​prfct

description.plain:
“prfct” is a song from Sabrina’s album “Singular Act 1”.
In this song, she talks about a relationship, she wasn’t comfortable in. “ It won’t be perfect but I know it could be worth it” – this verse means that this relationship could be “real” but she felt that this person is not for her.

songs.full_title: Bad Time by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Bad Time

description.plain: In this song, Sabrina talks about revenge, the way she made her partner (at the time) feel the same way they made her feel for a while. he was always busy doing things and leaving her, not thinking she was a priority. when he came back to her, she used the same line on him, she realized what she was doing for them and how little they cared about her. she wanted to say the same thing they did to her when she cared.

songs.full_title: Alone Together by Sabrina Carpenter
songs.title: Alone Together

description.plain:
“Alone Together” is a masterful piano ballad by Sabrina Carpenter, which was first performed at her  summer The De-Tour concert in Vancouver, Canada, in July 2017. As this song was intended to appear on her third album Singular, it was unfortunately scrapped at a later date.

On September 26, 2018, through her IGTV on the Instagram, Sabrina premiered this song in order to please her fans.
